programme.desc: BBC Three. The best in new entertainment, comedy, contemporary drama and music for the digital generation. Stay tuned for 60 Seconds news.
programme.title: This Is BBC Three

programme.desc: 9/13. Night Terrors: Sci-fi drama series. The Doctor must deal with sinister dolls coming to life as he fights to help a terrified child and his father. [AD,S]
programme.title: Doctor Who

programme.desc: 9/13. About a Boy: Confidential is on location, presenting behind-the-scenes action from a 17th century estate in the Gloucestershire countryside and a high-rise housing estate in Bristol. [S]
programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential

programme.desc: 2/11. Richard and Catherine: Richard and Catherine are given money towards their wedding, which Richard must organise alone. Can he live up to Catherine's expectations? [S]
programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride

programme.desc: 4/6. How Prejudiced Are We?: Cherry Healey finds out how prejudiced we are in today's politically-correct world, meeting a female firefighter, a black ballet dancer and a wheelchair user. [AD,S]
programme.title: Cherry Healey: How to Get a Life

programme.desc: Ireland's economic recession has led to a boom in the unlikely genre of Irish rap. This film follows bands like Class A'z as they try to find success. Contains very strong language. [S]
programme.title: Irish Rappers Revealed

programme.desc: 6/21. Quagmire's Baby: Animated comedy. Father doesn't know best when Quagmire assumes responsibility for a baby who looks just like him. Meanwhile, Stewie clones himself. Contains adult humour. [S]
programme.title: Family Guy

programme.desc: 7/21. Jerome Is the New Black: Animated US comedy. Peter and the guys interview potential friends to replace Cleveland. Brian discovers that Quagmire hates him. Contains adult humour. [S]
programme.title: Family Guy

programme.desc: 2/16. Meter Made: Animated comedy series. In order to be taken more seriously, Stan becomes a meter maid, and is intoxicated by power. Meanwhile, Hayley poses nude. Contains adult humour. [S]
programme.title: American Dad!

programme.desc: 3/16. Dope and Faith: Animated US comedy. Stan thinks God has sent him a friend but he's an atheist. Roger convinces Steve that he has been accepted by Hogwarts. Contains adult humour. [S]
programme.title: American Dad!

programme.desc: Radio 1's Gemma Cairney investigates how the 2011 UK riots changed the lives of those who got caught up in them, both perpetrators and victims. Contains some strong language. [S]

programme.desc: 5/6. Comedy series. Governor Margaret announces the annual prison choir competition. Helen is certain to be made lead vocalist until the surprise appearance of Virna. Contains adult humour. [AD,S]
